availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Pruett (Frankfort, Kentucky, sg-at-arms Ky senate, strong Unionist, printer)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, tailor, printer, and sergeant-at-arms. Kentucky native. Married to Amaryllis A. Conover Pruett. Father of James Pruett, John W. Pruett, Walter Pruett, and Emma Pruett. Merchant tailor in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Franklin County in 1850. Printer in Frankfort in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Frankfort in 1860. Elected sergeant-at-arms of the senate of Commonwealth of Kentucky in September 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 76B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 899.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, District 1, p. 234.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 488A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994034, Franklin County Births.
The War of the Rebellion: A Compilation of the Official Records of the Union and Confederate Armies ser. 2, vol. 2 (Washington, DC: Government Printing Office, 1890), 748.
"John W. Pruett (1816-1864)," Find A Grave, Memorial #126775790, accessed April 20, 2018, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/126775790.
